Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: vicki1812
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as on an RCI exchange in March 2012 in a 1 bed unit/suite. The location is great - immediately behind the Gritti Palace hotel and close to the water taxi stop (2 minutes walk from the Grand Canal) and approximately 5 minutes walk from the Airport water taxi stop at St. Marks square. Really close walking distance to everything that matters. The Palazzo is a mixture of timeshare and regular hotel with different room options. Our room was very spacious for Italy and espeically Venice, with a wonderfully large bedroom with quality linens, several enormous wardrobes, a large sitting room with 3 long sofas (1 of which converted into a sofa bed), a dining table and chairs and a very small kitchenette with a fridge, sink and 2 hotplates. There was no oven, microwave or diswasher and if you are on an exchange then you need to clean the kitchen yourself and leave it in the clean and tidy condition you found it in - I assume if you are a hotel guest then the cleaning is included - however no cleaning materials are provided so you would need to provide your own - was not an issue for us. There were plenty of plates, glasses and basic cooking items. There are a few grocery shops - see other reviews for where they are. We intended to self cater to keep costs down, but found that the tourist menus are good value (away from St. Marks) so ended up eating out. However be warned, everything in Venice is expensive - apart from the local wine which is excellent and you can buy 2 litres for 10 euros. The bathroom was reasonably spacious, sink, toilet, bidet and large jetted bathtub with shower over - all in marble with murano glass mirrors and accessories. Plentiful towels of very good quality - lots of hot water The unit is meant to sleep 5, for 2 it was very generous, for 4 or 5 it would be very snug - however the bathroom is separate from the main bedroom so there is an amount of privacy - but if 4/5 adults you would have to be very good friends as it could get a little crowded! Ideal for a couple of adults and 2 children. The hotel and the room were all immaculate and a credit to the housekeeping staff, and it is very evident that the staff take a lot of pride in their establishment. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly at all times - nothing too much trouble. We took advantage of a breakfast offer in the hotel and had breakfast in each day - if you are a timeshare guest then breakfast is chargable. It is a continential breakfast, and help yourself, but as much as you wanted with cereal, eggs, juice, milk, cheese, ham, yogurts, fresh fruit and an assortment of pastires, tea and coffee on demand - we found that this was quite substantial and kept us going for the day. It's quite basic but all well presented and fresh. The style of the hotel was traditional Venitian which is quite restrained - however there was lots of Murano glass and valuable wooden furniture and timeshare exchangers should be aware of the 700 euro deposit required at check in to cover any potential breakages of said items - in the room there were a couple of very valuable floor lamps, side lamps and mirrors and we were very concious of needing to take extra care! The deposit was taken with a credit card and returned at the end of the stay with no problem. This is the higest deposit we have ever paid during a timeshare exchange - but then it is Venice and the Murano glass is very expensive, espeically antique pieces like the ones they have in the hotel. It was very nice to have the antique pieces in the room - very different. Overall were were very pleased with out stay. Previously we have stayed at the Danieli and the room was as good as one of their standard rooms, the location better for us but without the wider benefits of the larger hotel and the stunning public rooms which the Danieli has. The hotel does have wi-fi and a guest PC - both of which are chargable for timeshare exchangers. Note that the hotel does not have any water views as it is on an internal square. The only minor critisim, is that unlike other reviewers, we did experience some noise whilst staying - the Gritti Palace next door is closed until 2013 and undergoing extensive rennovation and we did expereince some noise in the morning from the workmen - however the hotel is trying very hard to limit this where possible, but ask for more details if this is important to you. Had it not been for this factor I would have given my review 5 stars rather than 4. Did not really bother us as we are early risers and then were out and about all day and it is generally very quiet at night so a good night's sleep is avaiable. Venice is a quiet place generally - most folk go to bed early and most restaurants close around 10.30 - not the place if you are looking for late night parties.. Overall a great stay and would recommend this hotel for more of a traditional expereince. please email me if you want further details.

Reviews.Title: “DREAM COME TRUE”
Reviews.Author: plumbarius
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely charming, the old world charm really made you feel you were in and part of Venice. The staff was extremely helpful and delightful. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and gave us the feeling of being back in time. Not to mention the location, which was kind of out of the way, but still close enough to everything. As you can tell my wife and I truly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to see Venice for the first time.”
Reviews.Author: Retiredapril11
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was immaculate and spacious and had wonderful staff. We did not know what to expect since we had never been to Venice. We booked it on line which in itself was a pleasant experience done with ease. From our arrival to departure we were very satisfied and would highly recommend it to anyone. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful and served in a very welcoming atmosphere. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: CherylInMainz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic area, near everything but not on the main busy tourist drag. Very quiet at night. Easily within walking distance of San Marco, the Grand Canal and the Laguna. And for everything esle, the Vaporetta - Water Taxi stop(#1 line) is across from the hotel and a couple hundred feet down the "street." The hotel was lovely. It is decorated with a lot of Murano glass. The staff was friendly and helpful. All of them spoke english. There is a Billa grocery store not very far from the hotel. It on the Laguna near the Zattere stop on the # 2 Vaporetta line. Or take the #1 one stop to the Accademia and walk forward toward the Laguna. Turn right at the water, yellow building a couple blocks up.

Reviews.Title: “Worse 4 stars hotel i ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Ekaterina012
Reviews.Content: Even the hotel itself is perfectly situated our room was totally different from the pics on booking.com. the smell was like they were smoking in the room for last 20 years. the bathroom was very old and quite dirty as well as the room itself. the breakfast was too modest for 4 starts hotel. if you are ok about getting 2 stars paying for 4 this option will suit you perfectly

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: PBDenver
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean, friendly. Typical for Venice, it is a conversion from a some other use many years ago. Some rooms are small, others more spacious. All the rooms are different. We had a small 2 Rm junior suite w ktichen to fit 2 adults + i 11 yr old. Good location. Spent 4 days. Its a short distance walking from the water taxi drop off to the hotel. (we took a water taxi to and from the airport) That made it real easy, quick, and a bit of fun going down the canals to get there. Breakfast room very nice. Good food. Many choices. Continental. Friendly, helpful staff. Bit of a hike to the Biennial Art area (to the east). But not far by Venice walking standards. Many other art venues nearby. Away from the huge crowds that come off the tour boats. Overall, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Agni1
Reviews.Content: We get a small room (Number 103). I guess the other rooms are bigger (because of the 4 stars ranking). Our room was located on the backside (very quite) and we could enjoy a nice terrace. The bathroom has a lack of space for our private items. A good idea: remove this useless bidet and install a little commode for this purpose. Good breakfast, but why cheese slices in Italia??? The place is romantic, the hotel staff is perfect and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jurkovic
Reviews.Content: This year it was a second time to stay in 'Giglio'. Hotel is very close to Piazza San Marco but still in very quiet area. It is also good conected with vaporetto and surrounded by some good restaurants and shopping. The hotel is charming and it is a welcoming place with very helpful staff. Breakfast is simple but fair enough.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel on our Italy trip! Amazing service, great location, so comfy!”
Reviews.Author: TriGirlD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 4 hotels this October during our visit to Italy, and this was by far the best hotel. It was such a great find in Venice!! Reason's we loved it: 1) It's so easy to get to. One stop off the Grand Canal Vaporetto and you're there. No complicated walks down Venice alleys. Also, minutes from St Marks Square so very accessible to everything. 2) Large room for Italy. Decent bed, clean, great closet space, and really nice big bathroom. We also got a nice patio deck that we sat on at night drinking wine. 3) Great customer service, and little perks. The staff were so friendly (way above what we experienced in other places), and helped us with everything. They also included Palazzo del Giglio slippers in the room, free wi-fi in the room, and brought up a complimentary bottle of champagne on the last night we were there. Additionally, when we checked out, they gave us a Bach CD, which we listened to as we drove all throughout Tuscany. Breakfast was the only draw back as it was really basic, but my husband still enjoyed it. They served fresh croissants with nutella and various spreads, as well as coffee and cappuccino. Overall, you really can't beat this hotel in Venice. It was also amazingly priced for the room and the location. We absolutely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.........”
Reviews.Author: RJGGJR
Reviews.Content: Palazzo del Giglio was sold as a 4star hotel and it was as really nice comfortable place to spend a few days in Venice. The rooms were fine, but there wasn't any facilities for having a drink, not even a glass provided! The air conditioning had been turned off at the beginning of October (not advised at the time of booking!!) and the heating turned on regardless of the weather. The bedroom became too warm during the night to sleep in. Opening the windows resulted in my partner and me providing the mosquitoes of Venice with the perfect meal three nights on the trot. The hotel management didn't seem to understand what the problem was, but said they could provide us with a 'machine' which turn out to be a plug-in vapouriser which didn't work - all very disappointing!.

Reviews.Title: “A gem set in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: brutus02
Reviews.Content: This small exquisite hotel sits behind the Gritti; not too surprising since a while ago it served as an apartment facility for the guests of the famous hotel who required more space and perhaps peace. And that's exactly what the Giglio offers. Over the last twelve years I've made it my destination four times and each time I've found the welcome and service never varies. Let the hotel book the water taxi and the driver phones the desk and a porter is awaiting you at the Vaporetto stop that serves the area of S.M. Gigilio. Only Vaporetto No 1 stops there but it's the best route taking you to the Lido or the other way under the Rialto to the railway station. The campo is quiet but inside 5 minutes you are in the centre of San Marco. Another 5 minutes and you are over the wooden Accademia bridge and into the more leisurely Dorsorduro. If noise and bustle is what you want stay away from this small superb apartment hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nat_library
Reviews.Content: This atmospheric hotel is ideally situated near Piazza San Marco and is surrounded by some good restaurants and shopping. It is also a quiet area with very good vaporetto and water taxi access. The hotel is slightly old fashioned but I found this charming and it is a welcoming place. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast simple but good. My room faced onto a laneway at the rear which was quiet, but a room at the front facing the small square would be preferable. I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ClaudeBo
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for 3 days and were very pleased. The location is perfect, 5 minutes to San Marco, Theatro La Fenice (tip: get tickets in advance, it's really worth it) and just a few steps from the vaporetto exit so you don't have to roll your luggages a long way like many other hotels. The staff is very welcoming, they speak excellent english and are very efficient. Rooms are elegant and very clean and bathrooms include bath, good shower and clean ceramic tiles. The rates are very reasonnable. Breakfast is ok with croissants, pastries and good coffee. Very very quiet at night and in the morning. We will return there on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here and You Won't be Disappointed. I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: kitnsaly
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was just a short walk to Piazza San Marco and major other attractions! The rooms were very clean and quite spacious for European standards. The bathroom was impeccable, which is a must for me. I never knew staff could be so helpful. All hotels in every country should base their customer service off this hotel. The breakfast was amazing and I loved how it was delivered to my room at the time I requested. This hotel had a lot of charm and character! The price was reasonable. Even though there was no AC, it wasn't bad. I had one hot night where I had to keep my windows open. I could here the drunks on the street, but it wasn't a big deal especially considering everything else. Don't forget to ask about the group gondola discounts. It saves you a fortune!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Reasonable, Good Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelOften_9
Reviews.Content: Easy access. Bus from airport to Piazzale Roma or train to station. Or, walk up to Piazzale Roma from cruise ship. Then, inexpensive vaparetto, with easy roll-on of luggage, to Giglio stop, just after Ponte Accademia. Fifty meters straight to campo; hotel is on right. Reasonably priced. Good and friendly service and help for enterainment reservations, as well as a nice surprise delivered to our room. Room and bathroom were large. Bathroom amenities were excellent. Safe and lockable cabinets allowed us to secure everything, even luggage. Great location, with short scenic and shopping walks to Piazza San Marco, Ponte Accademia, and Ponte di Rialto sights and venues. We were happy to have our light but good breakfast in the large "bar" area. We recommend this hotel if you want all Venice has to offer, at a little less expense. Pay more elsewhere to be on a canal or for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little gem in the centre of Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnGuilford
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Venice and we booked this hotel through their website. When we arrived we were welcomed by very friendly staff who immediately helped us with a series of requests: we needed a good restaurant, and we needed to contact the airline because of a lost Blackberry. All was dealt with very efficiently. The hotel is very close to St. Marks Square, the suites are very spacious apartments that, in our case, very confortably accomodated four of us. Lovely bathrooms. The breakfast was quite abundant with fresh croissants and freshly squeezed orange juice. Overall a great experience which we shall gladly repeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: matureDevon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location , lovely staff .Cannot praise it enough , would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: artemisa5
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very central. Two minutes from St Mark's Square. We walk everywhere and did not need to use transport. Hotel was good, clean and pleasant. However, breakfast was not very good. We had to suplement breakfast with our food supplies bought in a supermarket nearby. Hotels in Venice are expensive, and overall this one was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Service, and Room”
Reviews.Author: BGrubb
Reviews.Content: Overall we loved the hotel. We stayed in a Junior Suite, Room 101. The location is great, with only a 2 minute (4 "blocks") walk from St. Marks square. The hotel can be reached even quicker than from St. Marks by using Vaporetto Line 1 to the Santa Maria del Giglio station walking 50 yds. down the alley and looking to the right accross the plaza. The room was very clean, the staff super friendly, and the contential breakfast was just right to get the day started. The room we stayed in a had a kitchen hidden behind cabinet doors. It had a full set of utinsels, plates, towels, etc. and a small refrigerator, a two burner stove, and a sink. Really we can't say enough good things about the location and staff. The web site could be more explicit about how to get there if you've never been to Venice before, which we hadn't. Not specific to the hotel but when you are walking the 2 minutes to/from St. Marks square or the San Marco Vaporetto stop you pass every high end store known to mankind: Gucci, Pucci, Valentino, Versace, Channel, Louis Vutton, Ferigomo (sp?) --- crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: hli66
Reviews.Content: We were a party of six traveling to Italy. Venice was our first stop. The Palazzo del Giglio is an excellent hotel. It is close distance to all major city sites. We had the top floor suite and a double room. Both rooms were very clean and had adequate amenities. The breakfast was amazing. The staff was friendly and courteous. They provided great restaurant recommendations. They even gave us a bottle of champagne. We would definitely stay at this hotel when we go back to Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Palazzo del Giglio
HotelInfo.Address: 2462 San Marco | Campo Santa Maria del Giglio, 30124 Venice, Italy
